intro: Erysimum virgatum, commonly known as the common wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features upright stems covered in glandular hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are bright yellow or orange, arranged in racemes, and bloom in early spring. Erysimum virgatum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in gardens due to its ornamental value.
